long_description: Graph sampling using the random walk algorithm.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: The names of the columns in the edges table that identify the target vertex of an edge. This set of columns must have the same schema as the vertex_attributes and source_vertex_attributes.
argument_clauses.description: The names of the columns in the edges table that identify the target vertex of an edge. This set of columns must have the same schema as the vertex_attributes and source_vertex_attributes.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: The names of columns in the input vertex table (vertices) to copy to the output vertex table (vertex_table_name).
argument_clauses.description: The names of columns in the input vertex table (vertices) to copy to the output vertex table (vertex_table_name).

argument_clauses.name: SampleRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: The sampling rate. This value must be in the range (0, 1.0). The default value is 0.15 (15%).
argument_clauses.description: The sampling rate. This value must be in the range (0, 1.0). The default value is 0.15 (15%).

argument_clauses.name: FlybackRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: The chance, when visiting a vertex, of flying back to the starting vertex. This value must be in the range (0, 1.0). The default value is 0.15 (15%).
argument_clauses.description: The chance, when visiting a vertex, of flying back to the starting vertex. This value must be in the range (0, 1.0). The default value is 0.15 (15%).

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: The seed used to generate a series of random numbers for sample_rate, flyback_rate, and any random number used internally. Specifying this value guarantees that the function result is repeatable on the same cluster. The default value is 1000.
argument_clauses.description: The seed used to generate a series of random numbers for sample_rate, flyback_rate, and any random number used internally. Specifying this value guarantees that the function result is repeatable on the same cluster. The default value is 1000.
